result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No contact with R.B. or her residence except if agent approves.

Domestic Violence Group

May not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed by a licensed provider.

May not possess drug paraphernalia.

May not be present where controlled substances are illegally sold or consumed.

May not have contact with known drug dealers or drug users or their residences.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Comply with any assessments, treatment, conditions or no contacts per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
